item.title: Fourth Case: Accusative
item.description: Usage Direct Object The fourth case, or accusative, is used when something happens to someone or something. In the sentence, it acts as the direct object. For example: “I buy a magazine, I read the newspaper.” Magazine and newspaper are direct objects (and take the accusative case) because they are being bought or read.
